info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 4:19PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Mineral, northwestern Lake, central Sanders and southwestern Flathead Counties through 500 PM MDT... At 417 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles northwest of Plains to 17 miles north of Paradise. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Plains, Big Arm, Hot Springs, Snider, Eddy, Bend, Weeksville, Elmo, Camas, Niarada, Dayton and Lonepine. This includes Highway 93 between mile markers 70 and 83. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
